alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 15 at 8:51AM CDT until June 15 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT FOR CENTRAL HENRY COUNTY... At 851 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Abbeville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Abbeville around 900 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Murphy Station, Graball, Dancey, Capps, Abbeville Municipal A/P, Willis Crossroads and Balkum. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
